definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Taking the ball away from someone on the other team is called stealing the ball.
sentences.chinese: 把球从对方球队之某人脚下截得叫做断球。

sentences.english: Milla stole the ball from Higuita and shot into the empty nets.
sentences.chinese: 米拉从伊基塔脚下断球，将球射入空门。

sentences.english: Taking the ball away from someone on the other team is titled stealing the ball.
sentences.chinese: 把球从对方球队的某人脚下截得叫做断球。

definition: to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
